names.pharmaceuticalLatin: Radix Alocasiae seu Euphorbiae Radix Euphorbiae Pallash Radix Euphorbiae Ebracteolatae Radix Stellariae

indications: Abdominal masses, edema, abdominal distension, anal fistula
Cough with dyspnea, swelling of the chest and abdomen, scrofula, cutaneous tuberculosis, chronic bronchitis

action.primary: Kills Intestinal parasites and alleviates pain

contraindications: Use with caution for those with gastroenteric ulcer.
incompatibilities: Inhibited by Lithargyrum #{MiTuoSeng} Mi Tuo Seng.

useCases: + 60g of this herb Take 2 or 3 pills at a time for a solid abdo-minal mass

notes: This herb may be pounded into a juice or powdered for topical application.
This herb has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells and relieve cancer pain.
This herb is said to cure deep-rooted carbuncles caused by parasites and scrofula.
